intro: Trichera tatarica, commonly known as the Tatarian trichera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the colder regions of Eurasia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of water bodies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
